title: Sanjeev Gupta buys Potts Point trophy home
text:
British billionaire Sanjeev Gupta has bought the historic Potts Point mansion "Bomera" for $35 million after a seven-month off-market campaign, market sources say.

The Italianate mansion set on a huge 2308 sq m block at 1 Wylde St, was owned by Leanne Catelan, the daughter of late property data pioneer Ray Catelan.

The historic Bomera mansion was sold for $35 million to steel billionaire Sanjeev Gupta.

The $35 million price tag would nearly triple the $12.5 million Ms Catelan paid for the property in 2013.

It is expected that the eight-bedroom, five-bathroom sandstone home overlooking Sydney Harbour will become the next home for Mr Gupta and his wife Nicola, who are renting a Bellevue Hill house from property developer Ian Joye for $30,000 per week.

Bill Malouf of LJ Hooker Double Bay confirmed the property was sold but would not comment on the details of the transaction.
description: British billionaire Sanjeev Gupta bought the historic Potts Point mansion "Bomera" for $35 million after a seven-month off-market campaign.
